image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Minnesota; born on a farm in Renville County, Near Buffalo Lake, Minn., October 11, 1904; graduated from high school in Brownton, Minn., 1923; member of the District No. 75 school board, 1926-1935; member of the Lynn Township, Minn., school board, 1929-1935; farmer; member of the Minnesota state senate, 1935-1949; delegate to the Republican National Conventions in 1948 and 1952; Lieutenant Governor of Minnesota, 1953; administrator of the Rural Electrification Administration Program, Washington, D.C., 1953-1956; elected as a Republican to the Eighty-sixth Congress; reelected to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1959-December 31, 1974); was not a candidate for reelection to the Ninety-fourth Congress in 1974; died on November 30, 1992, in Hutchinson, Minn.; interment in Oakland Cemetery, Hutchinson, Minn.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Nelsen, Ancher. "Lobbying by the Administration." In We Propose: A Modern Congress, pp. 143-59. New York: McGraw-Hill, 1966.
Ralph Nader Congress Project. Citizens Look at Congress: Ancher Nelsen, Republican Representative from Minnesota. Washington, D. C.: Grossman Publishers, 1972.

U. S. Congress. Senate. Nomination of Ancher Nelsen to be Administrator of the Rural Electrification Administration. Hearing before the Committee on Agriculture and Forestry. 83rd Cong., 1953. Washington: Government Printing Office, 1953.

researchRecord.name: 1944-1974, 28 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Ancher Nelsen include congressional office files, campaign files, files on Minnesota floods, and information on his service as head of the Rural Electrification Administration. The congressional files emphasize agriculture, health care, foreign trade, flood control, rural electrification, and the District of Columbia. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: In the Louis Edward Lerman Papers, ca. 1917-1978, 11 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Ancher Nelsen. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: 1970, 34 pages.
researchRecord.description: The interview of Ancher Nelsen forms part of: the Eisenhower administration project on the Rural Electrification Administration.

researchRecord.name: 1970, 35 pages.
researchRecord.description: The interview of Ancher Nelsen forms part of: the Eisenhower administration project on the Rural Electrification Administration. The inteview was furnished by an agreement with Columbia University.
